trans-unit.source: Creates a logical font with the specified characteristics

target.mrk: Creates a logical font with the specified characteristics

trans-unit.source: [optional] font weight, The following values are defined for convenience:

target.mrk: font weight, The following values are defined for convenience:

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the character set. The following values are predefined:
[optional] Specifies the output precision, It can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the output precision, It can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: Specifies the output precision, It can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS - Specifies the default font mapper behavior

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS - Specifies the default font mapper behavior

target.mrk: $OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS - Specifies the default font mapper behavior

trans-unit.source: $OUT_DEVICE_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a Device font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_DEVICE_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a Device font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

target.mrk: $OUT_DEVICE_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a Device font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

trans-unit.source: $OUT_OUTLINE_PRECIS - This value instructs the font mapper to choose from TrueType and other outline-based fonts

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_OUTLINE_PRECIS - This value instructs the font mapper to choose from TrueType and other outline-based fonts

target.mrk: $OUT_OUTLINE_PRECIS - This value instructs the font mapper to choose from TrueType and other outline-based fonts

trans-unit.source: $OUT_PS_ONLY_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose from only PostScript fonts.

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_PS_ONLY_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose from only PostScript fonts.

target.mrk: $OUT_PS_ONLY_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose from only PostScript fonts.

trans-unit.source: If there are no PostScript fonts installed in the system, the font mapper returns to default behavior

seg-source.mrk: If there are no PostScript fonts installed in the system, the font mapper returns to default behavior

target.mrk: If there are no PostScript fonts installed in the system, the font mapper returns to default behavior

trans-unit.source: $OUT_RASTER_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a raster font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_RASTER_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a raster font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

target.mrk: $OUT_RASTER_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a raster font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

trans-unit.source: $OUT_STRING_PRECIS - This value is not used by the font mapper, but it is returned when raster fonts are enumerated

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_STRING_PRECIS - This value is not used by the font mapper, but it is returned when raster fonts are enumerated

target.mrk: $OUT_STRING_PRECIS - This value is not used by the font mapper, but it is returned when raster fonts are enumerated

trans-unit.source: $OUT_STROKE_PRECIS - This value is not used by the font mapper, but it is returned when TrueType, other outline-based fonts, and vector fonts are enumerated

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_STROKE_PRECIS - This value is not used by the font mapper, but it is returned when TrueType, other outline-based fonts, and vector fonts are enumerated

target.mrk: $OUT_STROKE_PRECIS - This value is not used by the font mapper, but it is returned when TrueType, other outline-based fonts, and vector fonts are enumerated

trans-unit.source: $OUT_TT_ONLY_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose from only TrueType fonts. If there are no TrueType fonts installed in the system, the font mapper returns to default behavior

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_TT_ONLY_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose from only TrueType fonts.
If there are no TrueType fonts installed in the system, the font mapper returns to default behavior

target.mrk: $OUT_TT_ONLY_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose from only TrueType fonts.
If there are no TrueType fonts installed in the system, the font mapper returns to default behavior

trans-unit.source: $OUT_TT_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a TrueType font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

seg-source.mrk: $OUT_TT_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a TrueType font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

target.mrk: $OUT_TT_PRECIS - Instructs the font mapper to choose a TrueType font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the clipping precision, It can be one or more of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the clipping precision, It can be one or more of the following values:

target.mrk: Specifies the clipping precision, It can be one or more of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $CLIP_EMBEDDED - You must specify this flag to use an embedded read-only font

seg-source.mrk: $CLIP_EMBEDDED - You must specify this flag to use an embedded read-only font

target.mrk: $CLIP_EMBEDDED - You must specify this flag to use an embedded read-only font

trans-unit.source: $CLIP_LH_ANGLES - When this value is used, the rotation for all fonts depends on whether the orientation of the coordinate system is left-handed or right-handed.

seg-source.mrk: $CLIP_LH_ANGLES - When this value is used, the rotation for all fonts depends on whether the orientation of the coordinate system is left-handed or right-handed.

target.mrk: $CLIP_LH_ANGLES - When this value is used, the rotation for all fonts depends on whether the orientation of the coordinate system is left-handed or right-handed.

trans-unit.source: If not used, device fonts always rotate counterclockwise, but the rotation of other fonts is dependent on the orientation of the coordinate system.

seg-source.mrk: If not used, device fonts always rotate counterclockwise, but the rotation of other fonts is dependent on the orientation of the coordinate system.

target.mrk: If not used, device fonts always rotate counterclockwise, but the rotation of other fonts is dependent on the orientation of the coordinate system.

trans-unit.source: $CLIP_STROKE_PRECIS - Not used by the font mapper, but is returned when raster, vector, or TrueType fonts are enumerated

seg-source.mrk: $CLIP_STROKE_PRECIS - Not used by the font mapper, but is returned when raster, vector, or TrueType fonts are enumerated

target.mrk: $CLIP_STROKE_PRECIS - Not used by the font mapper, but is returned when raster, vector, or TrueType fonts are enumerated

trans-unit.source: For compatibility, this value is always returned when enumerating fonts

seg-source.mrk: For compatibility, this value is always returned when enumerating fonts

target.mrk: For compatibility, this value is always returned when enumerating fonts

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the output quality, It can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the output quality, It can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: Specifies the output quality, It can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY - Font is antialiased, or smoothed, if the font supports it and the size of the font is not too small or too large.

seg-source.mrk: $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY - Font is antialiased, or smoothed, if the font supports it and the size of the font is not too small or too large.

target.mrk: $ANTIALIASED_QUALITY - Font is antialiased, or smoothed, if the font supports it and the size of the font is not too small or too large.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you must select a TrueType font into a screen DC prior to using it in a DIBSection, otherwise antialiasing does not happen

seg-source.mrk: In addition, you must select a TrueType font into a screen DC prior to using it in a DIBSection, otherwise antialiasing does not happen

target.mrk: In addition, you must select a TrueType font into a screen DC prior to using it in a DIBSection, otherwise antialiasing does not happen

trans-unit.source: $DEFAULT_QUALITY - Appearance of the font does not matter

seg-source.mrk: $DEFAULT_QUALITY - Appearance of the font does not matter

target.mrk: $DEFAULT_QUALITY - Appearance of the font does not matter

trans-unit.source: $DRAFT_QUALITY - Appearance of the font is less important than when the PROOF_QUALITY value is used.

seg-source.mrk: $DRAFT_QUALITY - Appearance of the font is less important than when the PROOF_QUALITY value is used.

target.mrk: $DRAFT_QUALITY - Appearance of the font is less important than when the PROOF_QUALITY value is used.

trans-unit.source: For GDI raster fonts, scaling is enabled, which means that more font sizes are available, but the quality may be lower.

seg-source.mrk: For GDI raster fonts, scaling is enabled, which means that more font sizes are available, but the quality may be lower.

target.mrk: For GDI raster fonts, scaling is enabled, which means that more font sizes are available, but the quality may be lower.

trans-unit.source: Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized, if necessary

seg-source.mrk: Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized, if necessary

target.mrk: Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized, if necessary

trans-unit.source: $NONANTIALIASED_QUALITY - Font is never antialiased, that is, font smoothing is not done

seg-source.mrk: $NONANTIALIASED_QUALITY - Font is never antialiased, that is, font smoothing is not done

target.mrk: $NONANTIALIASED_QUALITY - Font is never antialiased, that is, font smoothing is not done

trans-unit.source: $PROOF_QUALITY - Character quality of the font is more important than exact matching of the logical-font attributes.

seg-source.mrk: $PROOF_QUALITY - Character quality of the font is more important than exact matching of the logical-font attributes.

target.mrk: $PROOF_QUALITY - Character quality of the font is more important than exact matching of the logical-font attributes.

trans-unit.source: For GDI raster fonts, scaling is disabled and the font closest in size is chosen.

seg-source.mrk: For GDI raster fonts, scaling is disabled and the font closest in size is chosen.

target.mrk: For GDI raster fonts, scaling is disabled and the font closest in size is chosen.

trans-unit.source: Although the chosen font size may not be mapped exactly when PROOF_QUALITY is used, the quality of the font is high and there is no distortion of appearance.

seg-source.mrk: Although the chosen font size may not be mapped exactly when PROOF_QUALITY is used, the quality of the font is high and there is no distortion of appearance.

target.mrk: Although the chosen font size may not be mapped exactly when PROOF_QUALITY is used, the quality of the font is high and there is no distortion of appearance.

trans-unit.source: Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized, if necessary

seg-source.mrk: Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized, if necessary

target.mrk: Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized, if necessary

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the pitch and family of the font. The two low-order bits specify the pitch of the font and can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the pitch and family of the font.
The two low-order bits specify the pitch of the font and can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: Specifies the pitch and family of the font.
The two low-order bits specify the pitch of the font and can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: The four high-order bits specify the font family and can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: The four high-order bits specify the font family and can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: The four high-order bits specify the font family and can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $FF_DECORATIVE - Novelty fonts. Old English is an example
$FF_MODERN - Fonts with constant stroke width, with or without serifs. Pica, Elite, and Courier New are examples

seg-source.mrk: $FF_MODERN - Fonts with constant stroke width, with or without serifs.
Pica, Elite, and Courier New are examples

target.mrk: $FF_MODERN - Fonts with constant stroke width, with or without serifs.
Pica, Elite, and Courier New are examples

trans-unit.source: $FF_ROMAN - Fonts with variable stroke width and with serifs. MS Serif is an example

seg-source.mrk: $FF_ROMAN - Fonts with variable stroke width and with serifs.

target.mrk: $FF_ROMAN - Fonts with variable stroke width and with serifs.

trans-unit.source: $FF_SCRIPT - Fonts designed to look like handwriting. Script and Cursive are examples

seg-source.mrk: $FF_SCRIPT - Fonts designed to look like handwriting.

target.mrk: $FF_SCRIPT - Fonts designed to look like handwriting.

trans-unit.source: $FF_SWISS - Fonts with variable stroke width and without serifs. MS Sans Serif is an example

seg-source.mrk: $FF_SWISS - Fonts with variable stroke width and without serifs.
MS Sans Serif is an example

target.mrk: $FF_SWISS - Fonts with variable stroke width and without serifs.
MS Sans Serif is an example
